description.para: These define alpha as the opacity of a surface.

memberdef.name: SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ALPHA
memberdef.initializer: ((SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_PACKED(format) && \ ((SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_PACKEDORDER_ARGB) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_PACKEDORDER_RGBA) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_PACKEDORDER_ABGR) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_PACKEDORDER_BGRA))) || \ (SDL_ISPIXELFORMAT_ARRAY(format) && \ ((SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_ARRAYORDER_ARGB) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_ARRAYORDER_RGBA) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_ARRAYORDER_ABGR) || \ (SDL_PIXELORDER(format) == SDL_ARRAYORDER_BGRA))))

detaileddescription.para: Pixel type.
Bitmap pixel order, high bit -> low bit.
Packed component order, high bit -> low bit.
Array component order, low byte -> high byte.
Packed component layout.
Planar mode: Y + V + U (3 planes)
Planar mode: Y + U + V (3 planes)
Packed mode: Y0+U0+Y1+V0 (1 plane)
Packed mode: U0+Y0+V0+Y1 (1 plane)
Packed mode: Y0+V0+Y1+U0 (1 plane)
Planar mode: Y + U/V interleaved (2 planes)
Planar mode: Y + V/U interleaved (2 planes)
Android video texture format

The bits of this structure can be directly reinterpreted as an integer-packed color which uses the SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA32 format (SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ABGR8888 on little-endian systems and SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA8888 on big-endian systems).

simplesect.para: Everything in the pixel format structure is read-only.

detaileddescription.para: Get the human readable name of a pixel format.

parameterdescription.para: the pixel format to query

simplesect.para: the human readable name of the specified pixel format or SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN if the format isn't recognized.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (Uint32 format, int *bpp, Uint32 *Rmask, Uint32 *Gmask, Uint32 *Bmask, Uint32 *Amask)
memberdef.name: SDL_PixelFormatEnumToMasks

detaileddescription.para: Convert one of the enumerated pixel formats to a bpp value and RGBA masks.

parameterdescription.para: one of the SDL_PixelFormatEnum values
a bits per pixel value; usually 15, 16, or 32
a pointer filled in with the red mask for the format
a pointer filled in with the green mask for the format
a pointer filled in with the blue mask for the format
a pointer filled in with the alpha mask for the format

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE on success or SDL_FALSE if the conversion wasn't possible; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (int bpp, Uint32 Rmask, Uint32 Gmask, Uint32 Bmask, Uint32 Amask)
memberdef.name: SDL_MasksToPixelFormatEnum

detaileddescription.para: Convert a bpp value and RGBA masks to an enumerated pixel format.
This will return SDL_PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN if the conversion wasn't possible.

parameterdescription.para: a bits per pixel value; usually 15, 16, or 32
the red mask for the format
the green mask for the format
the blue mask for the format
the alpha mask for the format

simplesect.para: one of the SDL_PixelFormatEnum values
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Create an SDL_PixelFormat structure corresponding to a pixel format.

Returned structure may come from a shared global cache (i.e. not newly allocated), and hence should not be modified, especially the palette. Weird errors such as Blit combination not supported may occur.

parameterdescription.para: one of the SDL_PixelFormatEnum values

simplesect.para: the new SDL_PixelFormat structure or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Free an SDL_PixelFormat structure allocated by SDL_AllocFormat().

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_PixelFormat structure to free

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Create a palette structure with the specified number of color entries.
The palette entries are initialized to white.

parameterdescription.para: represents the number of color entries in the color palette

simplesect.para: a new SDL_Palette structure on success or NULL on failure (e.g. if there wasn't enough memory); call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Set the palette for a pixel format structure.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_PixelFormat structure that will use the palette
the SDL_Palette structure that will be used

simplesect.para: 0 on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_Palette *palette, const SDL_Color *colors, int firstcolor, int ncolors)
memberdef.name: SDL_SetPaletteColors

detaileddescription.para: Set a range of colors in a palette.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Palette structure to modify
an array of SDL_Color structures to copy into the palette
the index of the first palette entry to modify
the number of entries to modify

simplesect.para: 0 on success or a negative error code if not all of the colors could be set; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Free a palette created with SDL_AllocPalette().

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Palette structure to be freed

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SDL_PixelFormat *format, Uint8 r, Uint8 g, Uint8 b)
memberdef.name: SDL_MapRGB

detaileddescription.para: Map an RGB triple to an opaque pixel value for a given pixel format.
This function maps the RGB color value to the specified pixel format and returns the pixel value best approximating the given RGB color value for the given pixel format.
If the format has a palette (8-bit) the index of the closest matching color in the palette will be returned.
If the specified pixel format has an alpha component it will be returned as all 1 bits (fully opaque).

If the pixel format bpp (color depth) is less than 32-bpp then the unused upper bits of the return value can safely be ignored (e.g., with a 16-bpp format the return value can be assigned to a Uint16, and similarly a Uint8 for an 8-bpp format).

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_PixelFormat structure describing the pixel format
the red component of the pixel in the range 0-255
the green component of the pixel in the range 0-255
the blue component of the pixel in the range 0-255

simplesect.para: a pixel value
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SDL_PixelFormat *format, Uint8 r, Uint8 g, Uint8 b, Uint8 a)
memberdef.name: SDL_MapRGBA

detaileddescription.para: Map an RGBA quadruple to a pixel value for a given pixel format.
This function maps the RGBA color value to the specified pixel format and returns the pixel value best approximating the given RGBA color value for the given pixel format.
If the specified pixel format has no alpha component the alpha value will be ignored (as it will be in formats with a palette).
If the format has a palette (8-bit) the index of the closest matching color in the palette will be returned.

If the pixel format bpp (color depth) is less than 32-bpp then the unused upper bits of the return value can safely be ignored (e.g., with a 16-bpp format the return value can be assigned to a Uint16, and similarly a Uint8 for an 8-bpp format).

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_PixelFormat structure describing the format of the pixel
the red component of the pixel in the range 0-255
the green component of the pixel in the range 0-255
the blue component of the pixel in the range 0-255
the alpha component of the pixel in the range 0-255

simplesect.para: a pixel value
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (Uint32 pixel, const SDL_PixelFormat *format, Uint8 *r, Uint8 *g, Uint8 *b)
memberdef.name: SDL_GetRGB

detaileddescription.para: Get RGB values from a pixel in the specified format.

This function uses the entire 8-bit [0..255] range when converting color components from pixel formats with less than 8-bits per RGB component (e.g., a completely white pixel in 16-bit RGB565 format would return [0xff, 0xff, 0xff] not [0xf8, 0xfc, 0xf8]).

parameterdescription.para: a pixel value
an SDL_PixelFormat structure describing the format of the pixel
a pointer filled in with the red component
a pointer filled in with the green component
a pointer filled in with the blue component

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (Uint32 pixel, const SDL_PixelFormat *format, Uint8 *r, Uint8 *g, Uint8 *b, Uint8 *a)
memberdef.name: SDL_GetRGBA

detaileddescription.para: Get RGBA values from a pixel in the specified format.

This function uses the entire 8-bit [0..255] range when converting color components from pixel formats with less than 8-bits per RGB component (e.g., a completely white pixel in 16-bit RGB565 format would return [0xff, 0xff, 0xff] not [0xf8, 0xfc, 0xf8]).
If the surface has no alpha component, the alpha will be returned as 0xff (100% opaque).

parameterdescription.para: a pixel value
an SDL_PixelFormat structure describing the format of the pixel
a pointer filled in with the red component
a pointer filled in with the green component
a pointer filled in with the blue component
a pointer filled in with the alpha component

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate a 256 entry gamma ramp for a gamma value.

parameterdescription.para: a gamma value where 0.0 is black and 1.0 is identity
an array of 256 values filled in with the gamma ramp

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Header for the enumerated pixel format definitions.
